description.narrative: MLSG plans and coordinates the decentralization process in the country in a systematic, inclusive and transparent way, and innovative services for citizens are designed and tested utilizing regional and inter-municipal cooperation.

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF MACEDONIA, THE FORMER YUGO

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order - human rights affairs

comment.narrative: (A1.2) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 platform for communucation between MLSG and citizens (A3.2) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 6 municipal websites (A4.3) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 Regional Centre for blind and visually impaired people in Pelagonija region (A4.5) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 Policy Paper on public capital investments (A6.1) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 updated Programme for Sustainable Local Development and Decentralization 2015-2020 and its Action Plan (A7.1) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 4 pieces of technical documentation developed

(A1.2) Platform www.lokalnasamouprava.mk fully operational. MLSG and SGUs admins and users trained. Platform handed over to MLSG. (A3.2) Websites for six municipalities fully operational. SGUs admins and users trained. Websites hosted and handed over to municipal administration. (A4.3) A regional centre for blind and visually impaired people in Pelagonija region constructed and commissioned and a programme developed for the establishment and operation of the centre. (A4.5) Policy Paper developed for public capital investments and regional development, including intermunicipal cooperation. (A6.1) The Program for Sustainable Local Development and Decentralization 2015-2020 reviewed and updated. the program's Action Plan for 2018-2020 developed. (A7.1) Three man designs and one feasibility study prepared for four rural municipality in the four planning regions to help them develop local infrastructure for promotion of tourism

(A1.2) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 platform for communucation between MLSG and citizens (A3.2) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 6 municipal websites (A4.3) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 Regional Centre for blind and visually impaired people in Pelagonija region (A4.5) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 Policy Paper on public capital investments (A6.1) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 1 updated Programme for Sustainable Local Development and Decentralization 2015-2020 and its Action Plan (A7.1) Baseline: 0 Target 2018: 4 pieces of technical documentation developed

(A1.2) Platform www.lokalnasamouprava.mk fully operational. MLSG and SGUs admins and users trained. Platform handed over to MLSG. (A3.2) Websites for six municipalities fully operational. SGUs admins and users trained. Websites hosted and handed over to municipal administration. (A4.3) A regional centre for blind and visually impaired people in Pelagonija region constructed and commissioned and a programme developed for the establishment and operation of the centre. (A4.5) Policy Paper developed for public capital investments and regional development, including intermunicipal cooperation. (A6.1) The Program for Sustainable Local Development and Decentralization 2015-2020 reviewed and updated. the program's Action Plan for 2018-2020 developed. (A7.1) Three man designs and one feasibility study prepared for four rural municipality in the four planning regions to help them develop local infrastructure for promotion of tourism

1.1. Upgrade (migration on MLSG server) and promotion of www.dajpredlog.mk web portal - Analysis of the web portal operation - Upgrade of the web portal based on findings and recommendations from the analyses - Posting the questions from the Survey of citizens' perceptions - Promotion of the upgraded web portal 2.1 Establishing e-System for local (administrative) regulations (eRegulations system) 4.1 Filling the IMC electronic records with data from 2014 IMC Status Report
4.2 Upgrade (migration on the MLSG server) and promotion of www.imc.org.mk website
4.3 Operationalization of the agreements with the 3 planning centers (Vardar, Northeast and Pelagonia) that established inclusive networks
4.4 Establishing IMC for blind persons and persons with vision disabilities in Pelagonia planning region 5.1 Effective implementation of the agreements on the establishment of Centres for Support of SMEs in five Centres for Planning Region Development (Skopje, Polog, East, Southwest and Southeast Regions)
5.2 Organization of a study tour to the Czech Republic and a workshop with Czech experts in the country 6.1 Implementation of the Methodology for monitoring of the implementation of the Programme with the Action Plan 7.1 Mapping of the potentials for development of forms of rural tourism and preparation of rural tourism registers in the four (4) least developed planning regions in the country (Northeast, Vardar, Southwest and Polog) in accordance with the Decision of the Government for classification of the planning regions based on the degree of development for the period 2013 – 2017 (OG 88/2013)
7.2 Establishment of partnerships between the municipalities and citizens associations in four (4) pilot municipalities (one in each of the four (4) least developed planning regions) for preparation of small infrastructure projects for rural tourism development by the communities/rural population.
7.3 Creation of a territorial network for promotion of the wealth of the rural areas through involvement of the local authorities, the local branches of the central authorities, the tourism operators, and the owners of rural tourism facilities (in the four least developed planning regions)

1.1. Upgrade (migration on MLSG server) and promotion of www.dajpredlog.mk web portal - Analysis of the web portal operation - Upgrade of the web portal based on findings and recommendations from the analyses - Posting the questions from the Survey of citizens' perceptions - Promotion of the upgraded web portal 2.1 Establishing e-System for local (administrative) regulations (eRegulations system) 4.1 Filling the IMC electronic records with data from 2014 IMC Status Report
4.2 Upgrade (migration on the MLSG server) and promotion of www.imc.org.mk website
4.3 Operationalization of the agreements with the 3 planning centers (Vardar, Northeast and Pelagonia) that established inclusive networks
4.4 Establishing IMC for blind persons and persons with vision disabilities in Pelagonia planning region 5.1 Effective implementation of the agreements on the establishment of Centres for Support of SMEs in five Centres for Planning Region Development (Skopje, Polog, East, Southwest and Southeast Regions)
5.2 Organization of a study tour to the Czech Republic and a workshop with Czech experts in the country 6.1 Implementation of the Methodology for monitoring of the implementation of the Programme with the Action Plan 7.1 Mapping of the potentials for development of forms of rural tourism and preparation of rural tourism registers in the four (4) least developed planning regions in the country (Northeast, Vardar, Southwest and Polog) in accordance with the Decision of the Government for classification of the planning regions based on the degree of development for the period 2013 – 2017 (OG 88/2013)
7.2 Establishment of partnerships between the municipalities and citizens associations in four (4) pilot municipalities (one in each of the four (4) least developed planning regions) for preparation of small infrastructure projects for rural tourism development by the communities/rural population.
7.3 Creation of a territorial network for promotion of the wealth of the rural areas through involvement of the local authorities, the local branches of the central authorities, the tourism operators, and the owners of rural tourism facilities (in the four least developed planning regions)
